task.summary: Default task
half started my first controller

-created a controller and got it to work with the index will now create a method to turn on/off the images aka hide. -ng show/hide does not affect fetching process only display so if i go to developer tools we see the iamges were still called. for this use ng-if instead of show
added bootstrap.css the glyphicons and an app.css and implemented its classes to nicely format the table suck at the button background and table.

retrieving data from backend web service and how to intercept the outgoing webserivce calls and mock results...created another module and added a dependencie to app.js..the newly added module makes calls to server.
removed the hardedcoded products and replaced with calls to backend webservice i believe..

removed the hardedcoded products and replaced with calls to backend webservice i believe..just spent over 3 hours trying to figure out what was wrong and turns out i missed a "("!!!!!!!!! in productResource.js...code is now set up to communicate to webservice. to use real data remove dependency in app. js productResourceMock
web service mocking method completed

am doing SPA therefore created a new vire for the productLists and moved the html there and onfigured the routing to that page using UIRouther by downloading it, then adding it as a dependency to app.js and marking in the index where othher tempaltes shall be placed

configured the routeing for the product list page and although theres no way to get there from the index typing it in url should work however it does not yet will contnue with guide and see if its just me not able to type in the correct url

added bootstrap.js and jquery so that the navbar works when the page is resized really small...also added code to display the navbar and added routes to edit and homepage..everything seems to work fine so far does redirect to product list tru navbar and url
build a view, controller configured the state, and activate it using ui-sref for theproductdetailsview
used resolve in productdetailctrl to obtain a single item from productResource aka the sopposed server
modified productEditCtrl by adding an abstract property and created editView Templates modified some html to display the editview is tab form.....

implemented some forms and a data binding....all child states of productEdit call parent which calls resolve which retrieves a single item and passes it to the controller which then passses that controller to the child only if a controler is not specified

implemented a date picker popup true use of uibootstrap and implmented code for popup click event
--figure out in the future how to implement the datepicker popup with the newer version of ui.bootstrap as it wont work something to do withdatepickerpopup and ng-model
implemented a save and canel method for editing and adding to items
added toastr to show a notification which shows up when the save is succesful

added required attributes to html input tags for as well as server side validation; using ngClass to set a css class dynamically based on an expression that defines the set of desired classes; used bootstrap css classes such as has-error along with validation message informing the user on the error; used $dirty to only display warning css once the user has made the mistake not immidiately
implemented other forms of validation eg:min and max length as well as their appropriate error messages

made is so that the form cannot be subbmited with errors as error messages were shown but it could still be saved so we prevented this by implementing the logic in controller..could of lso used the ng-disabled="form.%invalid" attribute in the submit button for the form
used created service to display margin percent in product details
implemented the product service into the newly created product price view
added angular charts js libary to project and a href link to d3 not sure if it will work yet tho....added a new navigation link to header but it leads no where yet
